headline: Snap-on Q1 Earnings & Revenues Miss Estimates, Stock Declines 6%
summary: SNA's Q1 results reflect sales and earnings decline amid economic uncertainty, with segmental softness particularly in the Tools Group.

headline: Snap-on (NYSE:SNA) Reports US$1,141 Million Sales in Q1 2025 With Earnings Decline
summary: Snap-on (NYSE:SNA) recently announced its Q1 2025 earnings, reporting a year-over-year decline in both sales and net income, with basic earnings per share dropping to $4.59 from $4.99. Despite this news, the company's stock price remained flat over the last month, echoing broader market trends where major indexes displayed mixed activity. The S&P 500 gained modestly, while the Dow Jones experienced a sharper decline due to external factors, including UnitedHealth's profit forecast cuts...

headline: Why Snap-on (SNA) Shares Are Getting Obliterated Today
summary: Shares of professional tools and equipment manufacturer Snap-on (NYSE:SNA) fell 8.6% in the morning session after the company reported weak first-quarter 2025 results: Its revenue missed significantly, and its EPS fell short of Wall Street's estimates. The big story was a 3.5% drop in sales, with most of that coming from weaker demand in the U.S. Tools Group. Overall, this quarter could have been better.

headline: Snap-on Stock Sinks as Toolmaker Attributes Soft Q1 Results to 'Uncertainty'
summary: Shares of Snap-on dropped sharply Thursday as its CEO attributed the toolmaker's weaker-than-expected results for the first quarter to "heightened macroeconomic uncertainty."

headline: Snap-On (SNA) Lags Q1 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
summary: Snap-On (SNA) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of -6.24% and 4.59%, respectively, for the quarter ended March 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Snap-on (NYSE:SNA) Reports Sales Below Analyst Estimates In Q1 Earnings
summary: Professional tools and equipment manufacturer Snap-on (NYSE:SNA) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales falling 11% year on year to $1.14 billion. Its GAAP profit of $4.51 per share was 6.4% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Snap-on Announces First Quarter 2025 Results
summary: KENOSHA, Wis., April 17, 2025--Snap-on announced first quarter 2025 results. A call discussing the results will be webcast beginning at 10:00 am Eastern on www.snapon.com.
